Module com.example.pingpong
Package com.example.pingpong.Controller

Class GameDAO

java.lang.Object
com.example.pingpong.Controller.GameDAO
All Implemented Interfaces:
IGameDAO
public class GameDAO extends Object implements IGameDAO
Data Access Object (DAO) for handling game persistence operations. This class provides an abstraction layer between the business logic and database management, delegating database interactions to the DatabaseManager.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameDAO()
    Constructs a GameDAO and initializes its connection to the database through DatabaseManager.

    • saveGame

      public void saveGame(Game game, String gameName) throws SQLException
      Saves a new game to the database.
      Specified by:
      saveGame in interface IGameDAO
      Parameters:
      game - The game object containing the current state to be saved.
      gameName - The name under which the game will be saved, acting as a unique identifier.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an SQL error occurs during the operation.

    • gameExists

      public boolean gameExists(String gameName) throws SQLException
      Checks if a game with the specified name exists in the database.
      Specified by:
      gameExists in interface IGameDAO
      Parameters:
      gameName - The name of the game to check.
      Returns:
      true if the game exists, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an SQL error occurs during the operation.

    • loadGame

      public Game loadGame(String gameName) throws SQLException
      Loads a game from the database using the given name.
      Specified by:
      loadGame in interface IGameDAO
      Parameters:
      gameName - The name of the game to load.
      Returns:
      A Game object representing the loaded game state or null if no game is found.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an SQL error occurs during the operation.
